exclusion:
1.  Bring hub close to switch, if possible

2.  Put hub in exclusion mode

3.  Tap DOWN three (3) times
inclusion:
1.  Put hub in inclusion mode

2.  Tap UP three (3) times
label: ZEN71
overview: Z-Wave on/off paddle switch, 700 series, operating in compatibility mode.
usage:
MANUAL CONTROL

Upper Paddle:

1 x tap: load on; Scene 1, attribute 00

2 x tap: Scene 1, attribute 03

3 x tap: enter inclusion (pairing) mode (only if the switch is not included to the hub); Scene 1, attribute 04

4 x tap: Scene 1, attribute 05

5 x tap: Scene 1, attribute 06

6 x tap: change LED indicator mode (see parameter 2)

held: Scene 1, attribute 01

released: Scene 1, attribute 02


Lower Paddle:

1 x tap: load off; Scene 2, attribute 00

2 x tap: Scene 2, attribute 03

3 x tap: enter exclusion (unpairing) mode; Scene 2, attribute 04

4 x tap: Scene 2, attribute 05

5 x tap: Scene 2, attribute 06

held: Scene 2, attribute 01

released: Scene 2, attribute 02

held for 10 seconds (LED indicator starts blinking): enter the setting menu >> 5 x tap down for factory reset; 5 x tap up to change LED bulb mode (see parameter 11); 2 x tap down to enable the range test tool.


All ZEN71 switches can be updated via OTA firmware updates, here is how to do that. You can request a firmware update file here, please include your order number for verification!

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: On/Off Paddle Orientation
parameters.description: Reverse default on/off operation or set to toggle mode
parameters.overview: Choose if you want the upper paddle to turn the light on or turn the light off when tapped.

options.label: Upper paddle turns the light on, lower paddle turns it off (default)
Upper paddle turns the light off, lower paddle turns it on

parameters.label: LED Indicator On/Off
parameters.overview:
Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when the switch (light) is on or off, or if you want it to remain on or off at all times.

NOTE: tap the upper paddle 6 times quickly to change this mode.

options.label: LED indicator is on when switch is off, otherwise off (default)
LED indicator is on when switch is on, otherwise off

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer (Minutes)
parameters.description: How long the switch remains on
parameters.overview:
Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-off timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn off once it has been turned on).

0 = disabled (default). Values other than 0, up to 65535, are the timer length, in minutes.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer (Minutes)
parameters.description: How long the switch remains off
parameters.overview:
Use this parameter to enable or disable the auto turn-on timer function (the time after which you want the switch to automatically turn on once it has been turned off).

0 = disabled (default). Values other than 0, up to 65535, are the timer length, in minutes.

parameters.label: On Off Status After Power Failure
parameters.description: How switch reacts to power failures
parameters.overview: Set the on off status for the switch after power failure.

options.label: Forced to OFF (regardless of state prior to power outage)
Forced to ON (regardless of state prior to power outage)
Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure (default)

parameters.label: Enable/Disable Scene Control
parameters.description: Whether scene control functionality is enabled
parameters.overview: Enable or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers.

parameters.label: Smart Bulb Mode: Enable/Disable Paddle
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable local on/off control. If enabled, you’ll only be able to control the connected light via Z-Wave. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.

NOTE: tap the upper paddle 10 times quickly to change this mode. NOTE: hold the lower paddle for 10 seconds until the LED indicator starts blinking, then within 2 seconds, tap the upper paddle 5 times quickly to change this mode. The LED indicator will stay solid green for 3 seconds to confirm the change.

options.label: Physical paddle and Z-Wave control disabled

parameters.label: 3-Way Switch Type
parameters.description: Two options for type of 3-way switch
parameters.overview: Choose the type of 3-way switch you want to use with this switch in a 3-way set-up.

options.label: Momentary switch, click once to change status (light ON or OFF)

parameters.label: Reporting Behavior for Parameter 11
parameters.description: Set reporting behavior for disabled physical control
parameters.overview: Whether to ignore status and not change LED state when physical control (11) disabled.

options.label: Switch always reports status and changes LED state (default)
No status or LED state change when physical control disabled

parameters.label: LED Indicator Color
parameters.overview: Choose the color of the LED indicator.

parameters.label: Association Reports
parameters.description: How the switch reports paddle control
parameters.overview: Choose how the switch reports its status back to the hub.

options.label: Z-Wave control = binary; paddle control = basic set
Z-Wave control and paddle control = binary (default)

documents.label: Device manual for ZEN21, substantially similar; electronic version of ZEN71 manual not yet available (2021-01-10)
